channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Rise After Six Straight Declines
item.description: Commercial crude oil stocks rose by 1.4 million barrels in the latest week, contrary to analysts’ expectations for a fall, but remain about 5% below the five-year average.

item.title: ‘He does not manage his own bills’: My brother is about to take Social Security. Should we put his inheritance from our father’s estate into an annuity?
item.description: “My other brother, who understands finances much better than me, says no one likes annuities.”

item.title: Mars Reaches Deal for Cheez-It and Eggo Maker Kellanova
item.description: Mars unveiled a nearly $30 billion deal for foodmaker Kellanova, a sign that big food companies are willing to pay up to increase their snacking portfolios.

item.title: Some hedge funds thought AI would help them beat the market. Then things got real.
item.description: The Eurekahedge AI Hedge Fund Index has lagged the S&P 500, proving that the machines aren’t learning from their investing mistakes.

item.title: Google's New Phones Aren't Really About the Phones
item.description: Latest Pixel series is another distribution channel for Google’s premium AI services—plus a bit of a flex against Apple.

item.title: ‘She’s now down to her last few dollars’: My friend quit her job, blew her inheritance and will take vacations using credit cards. Will she ever see sense?
item.description: “She has over $70,000 in her retirement fund, but says that’s for emergencies.”

item.title: The Big Risk for the Market: Becoming an AI Echo Chamber
item.description: Artificial intelligence was still the main source of profit growth for the S&P 500 this earnings season. But AI-driven firms are largely boosting each other’s profits.

item.title: ‘I only get Social Security’: I’m 72 with two adult children and live in a home for low-income seniors. Do I really need a will?
item.description: “Everything I own is probably only worth $500.”

item.title: The Dramatic Turnaround in Millennials' Finances
item.description: It wasn’t the avocado toast. Soaring home prices and smart investments have helped change the narrative for a generation once mocked for being perpetually behind.

item.title: 6 ways to build a successful retirement
item.description: What people in their 50s, 60s and 70s should know about navigating life after work
